amendment.description: An amendment numbered 30 printed in Part B of House Report 118-269 to increase and decrease funding for the Small Business Administration's Office of the Inspector General by $1 million to provide Congress a report on the estimated fiscal impact of selling off delinquent loans within the COVID-19 portfolio to third parties and a cost-benefit analysis of not pursuing aggressive loan recollection efforts to recoup the estimated $33.4 billion in either past due, delinquent, in liquidation or charged off EIDL loans.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment (A014) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment (A014) Agreed to by voice vote.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment (A014) Agreed to by voice vote.
